And Job answered and said,
No doubt but ye <FI>are<Fi> the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

But I have understanding as well as you; I <FI>am<Fi> not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?<RF>understanding: Heb. an heart<Rf><RF>I am…: Heb. I fall not lower than you<Rf><RF>who…: Heb. with whom are not such as these?<Rf>
I am <FI>as<Fi> one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright <FI>man is<Fi> laughed to scorn.
He that is ready to slip with <FI>his<Fi> feet <FI>is as<Fi> a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.<CM>
The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth <FI>abundantly<Fi>.
But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?
In whose hand <FI>is<Fi> the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.<RF>soul: or, life<Rf><RF>all…: Heb. all flesh of man<Rf>
Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?<RF>mouth: Heb. palate<Rf><CM>
With the ancient <FI>is<Fi> wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
With him <FI>is<Fi> wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.<RF>With…: that is, With God<Rf>
Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.<RF>up: Heb. upon<Rf>
Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
With him <FI>is<Fi> strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver <FI>are<Fi> his.
He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.<RF>speech…: Heb. lip of the faithful<Rf>
He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.<RF>weakeneth…: or, looseth the girdle of the strong<Rf>
He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them <FI>again<Fi>.<RF>straiteneth: Heb. leadeth in<Rf>
He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness <FI>where there is<Fi> no way.
They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like <FI>a<Fi> drunken <FI>man<Fi>.<RF>stagger: Heb. wander<Rf><CM>
